title: title
triangle
code:
(group {curve=false mode=fill count=100})
{speed=.1}
(repeat 10 | {! w=px*5 *1,H a=.1} [0,0 {> +0,~speed*.1} 1,.5 {<} 0,1]
{+1,0 *-1,1} [0,0 {> +0,~speed*.1} 1,.5 {<} 0,1])

my wife just died
it was not, exactly, by chance

she got lost in the difference
between real
and artificial.

the face is...

title: new
code:
(choose S | (group {curve=false}) | (group {curve=false a="pow(triangle(P-T*(1+hash(C))-hash(C)),4)"}))
{speed=.1}
(repeat 10 | {! w=px*5 *1,H a=(sah #T ~#)} [0,0 {> +0,~speed*.1} 1,.5 {<} 0,1]
{+1,0 *-1,1} [0,0 {> +0,~speed*.1} 1,.5 {<} 0,1])

below: a system of flows,
quantum catastrophe.

nothing is fixed:
collective coincidence,

action at a distance. 
i made whole efforts 
for superfluid.

title: part I: possible computation
code:
{*1,H}
(group {curve=false count=200 a="pow(triangle(P-T*(1+hash(C))-hash(C)),4)" vert="0,sin(output.position.x*20)*pow(S,4)*.3"})
(repeat S*40+2 
| {w=px4 hash=#} [0,(> (bell i hash) .4 .6) +.5,0 1,(bell i hash)])

it starts with two slits:
two flows, choice point, magnify:
& the possibilities interfere.

in the paths, we trace
a set of waves...
arising from an imposition
of all that is possible.

title: multipaths
code:
(group {count=8 a="pow(triangle(P-T-hash(C)),4)"})
{a=1}
(remap 0,0.5*H 1,0.5*H)
{speed=3 a=1}
(repeat 100 
| [0,0]+ (repeat 2 | {noise=~speed} [(sah ~speed-.5 noise)[+I+1/(N+1),*H]]+) [1,0])

(? S-.5 | then | else)

so instead of tracing one path,
it's irreducible:

title: one person inbetweenen
code:
(group {count=8 a="pow(triangle(P-hash(C)),4)"})
{a=1}
(remap 0,0.5*H 1,0.5*H)
{speed=.1 a=1}
(repeat 1000 
| [0,0]+ (repeat 2 | {noise=~speed} [(sah ~speed-.5 noise)[+I+1/(N+1),*H]]+) [1,0])

(? S-.5 | then | else)

a microcosm,
where we know for sure

how fast or how far,
but never both.

so am I cursed to frozenness?

(group {count=8 a="pow(triangle(P-hash(C)),4)"})
{force=>S-(C/30)%1 w=>#*force}
(remap 0,0.5*H 1,0.5*H)
{a=1}
(repeat 100 
| [0,0]+ (repeat 2 | {noise=~1} [#C-.5[+I+1/(N+1),*H]]+) [1,0])

(? S-.5 | then | else)

title: feynman
code:
so an observer could paint this portrait
of her...with a diagram:

here, two particles merge, emit one photon
and reabsorb.

(repeat S^2*30_1+1 |
{! +i,0 *1/N,1}
(group)
(remap 0.5,H 0.5,H*2/3 -0.5)
{xsplay=>(<> (bell (sah #T (~ 4 1+#,1.3))) 2 0) pos=1,xsplay,2,xsplay}
[0,-1 pos[0,1]] [0,1 pos[0,1]]
[pos[2,3] 3,1] [pos[2,3] 3,-1]

(group {count=300 vert="sin(output.position.y*100)*.05,0"
a="pow(triangle(P-T*3-hash(C)),4)+pow(triangle(P-T*3.2-hash(C)+.234),4)+pow(triangle(P-T*4.3-hash(C)+.546),4)"})
[pos[0,1] pos[2,3]])

title: part II: black box
code:
(group {curve=false count=100})
{as=1,0 ws=1,.8}
(repeat 2
| {! +.5,H.5 @(sah (~ 3 #) ~2)*(> S px10 0.1) *.5 +-.5 w=>(px (sah (> ~ 30 100)*wsI (~ 1 #,2))) l=asI} [0,0 0,1 1,1 1,0]<)
(group)
{!}
(align .5,.5*H .5,.5
| {*1/30} (choose S | "I." | "II." | "III." | "IV." | "a."))

A: what do you seek?
B: No more than you.
   No less than you.
